column2:
mu = identity; sigma = identity; nu = identity 
Formula: pitch_sd ~ 0 + affect_group 
   Data: df_best (Number of observations: 2997) 
  Draws: 4 chains, each with iter = 4000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup draws = 12000

Regression Coefficients:
                       Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
affect_groupExpressive   922.08      2.48   917.19   926.89 1.00    10980     8129
affect_groupFlat         783.92      2.75   778.54   789.29 1.00    10586     8454

Further Distributional Parameters:
      Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
sigma    85.73      1.91    82.02    89.51 1.00     9178     8587
nu        4.91      0.43     4.14     5.83 1.00     9389     8748

Draws were sampled using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
